Such a shame this place has such terrible service because the atmosphere and happy hour is great! Have rented a karaoke room, came for lunch and did happy hour... Every time horrible service! Long waits for food and drinks, servers and bartenders have poor attitudes... Pretty sure we won't be back

Happy Hour is legit here.  I love any place in Olde Town that looks great and has a great crowd but it doesn't take a strippers pay check to hang out.  This is a place like that.  Went at happy hour for a friends birthday.  We ordered what seemed liked everything on the menu and everything was delish and nothing broke the bank.  Very pleased.  Im not a sushi snob in anyway as you can see I like almost every place I go to. However, do to the fact that they have great food, waitresses, great bathrooms, and a pic of Jimi Hendrix at the bar this place easily gets 4 stars.  Only reason I wont give it 5 is I have been here at night and the place has gotten too crowded and that gets annoying.  4 1/2 stars

Best. Karaoke. Ever.  For my boyfriend's birthday, I went balls to the wall with their uber-fancy, 20+ person private karaoke room with its own patio. At $150 an hour, I was cringing a little at the outset. However, after a number of surprisingly inexpensive vodka cranberries ($5 each.... and this is Scottsdale!), I found myself fondling my boyfriend's boss as he sat on my lap while watching my normally prim liquored-up friends work the conveniently provided stripper pole like pros. Plenty of Journey, AC/DC, and Black Sabbath provided the perfect backdrop for the shenangians. We made sure to keep the door open even though the staff kept trying to tell us to close it, and even those too-cool-for-you Scottsdale fuckers walking by the bar were stopping and checking out the mayhem. Fabulous. It's almost a week later and people are still talking about it. This will be an annual birthday tradition -- mark my words. Worth every last penny.

I am a regular at this sushi spot with my mom. Atleast once a week, sometimes 2-3 times. We sit at the bar and LOVE our bartender Matt. He engages in conversation, but doesn't hover where you feel like you cant eat or have a conversation with who you came with. Happy hour is 3-7 on weekdays and all day Sunday. Half off apps, house maki and house cocktails? Cant beat it. At night, this place fills up and the music gets a bit louder, definitely a spot to come for drinks before a night out in OT, or a spot you should stop on your night out for some flavored sake.   Our fav cocktails: blushing geisha, shiso horny Apps: rockin shrimp, pork gyoza, (new) snow grab mozz sticks "Lighter fare" sushi: seared salmon special is TO DIE FOR.   Love this place. Never had a bad experience -guess I eat all my food before taking any photos....

Came for Sunday funday several times with my baby and sat on side that is closed off and had no problems, today came out again for Sunday funday and manager said that side is 21 and older even though it's quieter and not many people manager would not make an exception. We love this place and are loyal customers, but this made us not want to come back
Really enjoyed the atmosphere at this place. Good food, drinks, and music. They had a live DJ on a Sunday.
I have been coming here for the past few years.  Food is always good and not over priced.  Sunday all day happy hour is my favorite day to come here.

Last Saturday two of my girlfriends and I went in for dinner for one my my friends birthday. It was a pleasant place, the food was good and decently priced. It was loud, but that was the type of atmosphere this place was going for, which is something I'm not going to complain about. The only unfortunate part of the evening was our server. Our sever was ignoring us consistently through out the night, and we sat for a decent amount of time waiting for her to come over to take our orders. But, it was busy, so none of us were too bothered by the situation, so we shrugged it off and understood.  The thing that really got us is that we all split the check, two of us paying with credit and one with cash. When another server returned with our checks, the server who had been taking care of us pocketed the rest of the cash in my friends check book. My friend was planning on leaving that amount anyway, but the fact that the server assumed she was being tipped that amount (which was approx. 27% for her portion of the bill), was rude and the last straw for tipping our server a larger amount. So, myself and the other friend of mine left a small amount of money on both of our bills, leaving the server with a 10% tip, and pretty annoyed customers.  I definitely would have gone again if I had not had to be taken care of by that server again, but unfortunately, the server has left a really disgusting taste in my mouth. Checking my bank statements this morning and doing some budgeting, I found that the server had over charged me, giving herself a 20% tip on my credit card receipt.  I myself have worked in the food industry for nearly 6 years, and I have seen servers come and go for "stealing" from customers, and a few get arrested for it as well. I do not wish that on this girl, but I do want it brought to the management's attention. This is absolutely inappropriate, especially when you are working to create a name for yourself in Scottsdale food industry. I hope you can look into this a bit more, and find out which one of your servers is doing this.

Visited Geisha on a Saturday night without reservations. We were lucky to find seats at the bar for a drink and apps but were promptly ignored. Managed to order the standard edamame (can't screw that up) and chicken potstickers which were mushy and tasteless.  We chose the Phat Daddy, spicy tuna, and two other rolls for dinner and the phat daddy was the best. The spicy tuna wasn't spicy nor was it flavorful.  We had a round of mango sake bombs which was definitely an experience.  Not bad for the price but not sure I'd go back.

My fiance and I went here a couple weeks ago and were disappointed. We ordered 4 different rolls and none of them were good enough to make us want to return. We got one that was a chicken roll and it was awful, the chicken was dry and flavorless. Probably won't be returning.

Let's face it: Arizona is not known for its sushi. Sadly, this girl loves sushi. So A few months back a few girls and I decided to come get drinks here before a night out on the town. The drinks are inventive and delicious with adorable names. The first time around I only got drinks, but liked them and the atmosphere enough to bring friends back who were visiting from another landlocked state. This time, we ordered adorably named drinks and sushi. The sushi was fantastic! I was so impressed with the quality of the food, considering the place was packed with a gagillion people all ordering sushi at once. I have been back a few times since and would highly recommend sitting at the sushi bar. It is fun to watch the chefs, and it is out of the way enough that you don't feel bombarded by the other guests. The last time we went, we even had a great conversation with the chef about his recent trip to Japan. Very entertaining. Sunday nights are obscenely busy for one reason or another (can't remember why, but there is a reason for it) and nighttime in general brings in a rowdier "Scottsdale scene" crowd. But I love it. And I love so much about this place. The best sushi I have had so far in Arizona with great service to boot!
go to spot for a first date they have the best drinks "hello kitty martini" any fruit infused sake or miso horny lol service is great always the food is good basic sushi rolls nothing spectacular

This place has really bad customer service and is anything but accommodating to their guests. I made a simple request and tried to order nigiri with avocado instead of fish since I am vegan, and was told they could not accommodate my request. There is NO reason a sushi restaurant can't put a piece of avocado on top of some rice. I wrote them two Facebook messages about my experience there asking for follow up and the messages were read and ignored. I've also heard several other friends of mine say their kitchen is not accommodating to their needs, vegan or not.

Pretty good sushi in the Valley, but honestly, I find most of the rolls to taste almost exactly the same. They're good, but they can get a little boring after a few visits compared to some other sushi places I've tried. The environment is nice, but happy hour is the real reason to come here. During happy hour, sake is pretty inexpensive, and they have tons of fruit-infused flavors! Overall, decent place.

This was one of the many places we stopped at for our pub crawl and I'm definitely a fan. Where else can you go to snag $4 saki bombers!? Exactly! With 1/2 priced signature house drinks and 1/2 priced maki sushi menu and appetizers, you're sure to get your moneys worth.

Best Happy Hour. I try not to go any other time, otherwise prices are a bit, hm, pricey?   And automated heated toilet seats...I've never been so ashamed of spending so much time in a public restroom before in my life. Hey, its been cold outside...and I have a lot to warm...  Thank G-d for the heaters on the patio too, although people with better circulation and more than enough insulation complain about it, I was more than appreciative for them!  Great service, awesome tunes and good edibles. Even if you have to wait for a bit or put up with a little bit of douchebaggery that is Scottsdale, its well worth it.

Decent food but sub par service. As a frequent restaurant go-er, I'm used to wrong orders, busy restaurants and less than attentive service. The thing that sets a great customer service restaurant apart from the rest is a willingness to admit fault and apologize. The manager was apologetic but we were not compensated for our horrible service ... The waitress scoffed at us when we asked to see the manager and was unbelieving when we said our drink order was incorrect

Can't say I was too impressed with my night at Geisha A Go Go. It was a friend's birthday and some other friends reserved a private karaoke room for 10 people.   Walking in I was shocked to see how small the room was. There was a small bench and 10 of us had to squeeze to even fit. It was not very comfortable - especially for the people sitting in the corner. It was also very hot in the room so that did not help matters.  I was also surprised the room was not decorated better. Just 4 blank walls - boring.  We had the room reserved from 7 to 9. I know for a fact we arrived after 7 because I hate to be late. As we were getting settled in the waitress told us which drinks and sushi were on happy hour. Great, we thought - let's all order half price drinks. So we ordered accordingly - happily getting drinks and sushi on the "happy hour" list. Well when the bill came everything was full price! When I asked the waitress she said "when I told you about it, it was still happy hour but when you ordered it wasn't happy hour anymore." Wow, seriously? That's shady. I didn't want to make a scene since it was my friend's birthday but that really bugged me. I looked on their site later to find happy hour ends at 7 so she should have never told us that in the first place. Or at least told us when we finally did place our order. Bad waitress!  The room comes with free apps and sushi which is cool considering the price of the room. The food was all good but nothing amazing. There are other sushi places in town I would go to before going back here. The drinks were pretty mediocre as well. The names are better than the beverages themselves.  Needless to say I do not think I will be returning anytime soon.

Greg Donnally, Brian Chittenden and Andrew Nam, the team behind Drift and Stingray Sushi, have another restaurant opening on Friday, Feb 22.  Donnally calls it an "Asian Bistro Lounge" and takes his inspiration from the lounges and clubs he saw on a recent trip to Japan.  He says that it is the kind of place where Japanese men go after work to unwind, and to have drinks.  When you enter, you are confronted with brightly lit modern versions of the Pachinko machine.  Pachinko is a cross between the pinball and video slot machines.  They have "private" karaoke rooms which i suspect will be well fueled by the post work drinks.  The menu will have a lot of shareable plates and, of course, sushi.  They also boast a variety of infused sake and shochu.  I'm looking forward to the opening.... Pass me a sake, anyone wanna karaoke?

Oh Geisha - why are you so GOOD to me?!? Yes, you are a bit pricey but who can resist HH specials for 7 days/week? Very lovely.  Sushi always comes out promptly and tasty. Excellent/friendly service always. Sake and beer just pairs so beautifully w/everything.  Love the decor here - great job. Love the Morrison/Hendrix/Vicious posters. Love the rock in the middle of the room. And, the best feature, the toilets in the ladies room. They have controls on the wall for cleansing options and everything is by sensor. Someday, I too will have such a sophisticated toilet.  Love you Geisha!!

This is one of my favorite places in Old Town. In fact, it's one of my favorite places in the whole valley. The Japanese-Americana fusion atmosphere is pleasant and well done, the food, from the sushi to their cooked fare, is quite good and the staff is typically very friendly and attentive. Plus, their Happy Hour specials are great! It can be a little loud when it's packed (especially during their happy hour specials), but I don't recall ever having to yell across the table to have a conversation.   Definitely check this place out!
The food was very tasty. The service fantastic and the atmosphere fun. I would suggest this to anyone wanting great happy hour.
I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. Geisha sushi was moderately priced and we totally liked their food. Ambience was rocker meets Japan, non-pretentious and the service was great.

My favorite go-to sushi spot. Their happy hour is great, love their music, and I always have a great experience. Their sushi is amazing. Sometime the service is a little slow when it's really busy, but overall awesome restaurant. I'm a fan!

The first I even went here was for my birthday in Nov. It was actually a first for my entire party.  Me and my BFFs pretty much have made this place our spot for girls night out!  Food is great! Staff is friendly! Oh and the bathroom is awesome! lol!
Love the Hello kitty drink here! Great happy hour prices!

We were recently at Geisha a Go-Go for a friends birthday for dinner and karaoke.  First we did dinner, then karaoke in the BIG room, which was a blast.  My issue was our waitress. We were there on a Tuesday night and we were some of the only people in the place, so the excuse "it was just really busy" doesn't apply.  A couple of us ordered Hot Rock dinners, which were supposed to come with rice. Our meals came with no rice and when we brought it up to the waitress, the following conversation ensued:  Us: Hi, I think our meal is supposed to come with rice, right? Waitress: Yeah, but usually the meat is filling enough, so I didn't bring it out. Us: Okay, but it's listed on the menu. Waitress: I know.  Um, I'm still being charged for it, right? And the Shrimp Hot Rock meal came with 3 shrimp and a tiny Asian salad.  Wow, how filling. There were other issues with her service, like bringing out the other, more expensive wine that I didn't ask for twice.  I will probably never go back to Geisha for a meal, but it is a good place for drinks at the bar with friends on the weekend. Or on a weeknight if you don't want a big crowd but fun atmosphere.  The reason for the "Meh, I've experienced better" rating, and why it is not at an "Eek! Methinks not" is because we did have a good time...when we didn't have to deal with the waitress.

Dang, where to start with this place. Myself and a group of about 15 people come here several times a year. Last Friday evening was definitely the last. Emily (if this was really her name, we asked for our servers name and the hostess stuttered a bit, so not too sure if Emily is accurate) she is typically is always in the back room/private area. Her personality is horrible, her service is horrible, she sat on her cell phone about 90% of the time and we were her only table for at least three hours. On top of that she has a little helper following her every footstep and he was just as bad as she was. We would politely ask about our food order and it wouldn't come, we would ask her again after some time where our food was and she said it was coming. Then 45 minutes went by and we would ask again and she went straight to the computer to put in the order which probably means she didn't put it in in the first place. A spicy tuna roll is the simplist of sushi rolls, shouldn't take that long to get. It seems like a pattern with this place and specifically her by reading other reviews, tip is already added...20% so they don't care at all! Sad, we come here multiple times a month and have decided to NEVER come back because of this last experience this past weekend! Even more disappointing is management and the owners must not be keeping up with the reviews because from others I have spoken to seems like a pattern with this same server/bartender and always in the private/karaoke room. I would give zero stars if it was possible!

Finally getting to this one, We have been regulars there, me and my assorted peeps. I generally got for the Sunday 3pm Happy Hour. Place gets packed fast so don't blame me if you get stuck in the sun outside. Beer is half off, so is most of the appy menu and some sushi. The music is great, service is superb, and the place is very trendy and has a super cool vibe. We have ordered the ribs, wings, fried rice, ramen, and assorted sushi. All were tasty. And priced right at happy hour. Karaoke rooms available for parties and the staff is cute and peppy, never an empty glass for us. Great place to hang or bring a date. Get a reservation if you go during busy time or they will turn you away  or sit you in the sun, Bummer.

If you lock your keys in your car and your phone is dead they give zero shits. I will never come here again, they treated a paying customer like crap. The manager gave me such a hard time about using their phone to call AAA, totally rude.

first of all i don't appreciate being yelled at "WERE CLOSE!" from a female bartender, upon walking into this establishment i waited 5 minutes before someone offered a table and in those quiet 5 minutes i saw at least 3 employees and no one had the decency to say "someone will be with you shortly" good food but terrible service.   never again.....

I never got to actually go here. When we arrived at 8:30 we were told by a bouncer at the door that you have to be 21+ after 8. It was a Friday night. I'm not sure if this is just a weekend thing or not. I'm also not seeing this mentioned anywhere on their website.
Love this place! (Used to love it a ton more when rainbow rolls were on happy hour!) Nonetheless still a staple in our sushi habits! Happy hour still kicks ass! Check out the karaoke bar in the back!
Great happy hour pricing and food.  Make sure your entire party is present or they won't seat you.

My favorite drink here: Shiso Horny. That name alone should sum up the outlandishness that is this rock'n'roll themed karaoke sushi bar.   The inside is both cavernous and cramped. When you first walk in through the giant green door, it's like you are entering the walk-in closet of a Japanese slot machine hoarder. You have the option of sitting inside or on the patio, or renting one of their three karaoke rooms. We almost always sit on the patio since the inside is so dark that I'm afraid I might wind up in the wrong bathroom. The karaoke rooms are nice, although intimidating as you are being led down a dark hallway to a room in which your companions will most certainly make fun of you. Depending on your group size, 5 could fit comfortably in the smaller room whereas 8 is pushing the limits (imagine spilled drinks and dropped sushi). They larger room is intended for 10 - 15 and is pretty spacious. The sound system takes a bit to get used to, especially figuring out if it's plugged in correctly or trying to input numbers for the song selections. Once you get the hang of it, its smooth sailing and the only bumps are trying to decide which song to sing next.   The Happy Hour here is fantastic - half priced karaoke rooms, maki, appetizers, sake, and house specialty drinks from 4 - 7pm every day. We can get away with a ton of food for very little money - it's great. I think we've tried almost everything in the appetizer section - our favorite being the teriyaki ribs. Then, we normally order the dragon roll. Their sushi is good, standard for the most part, but the specialty rolls have some pretty cracked out names. One of our favorites is the Gaijin - a chimichanga styled sushi roll, deep fried and delicious with cream cheese and avocado. We haven't ventured much into the other areas of their menu - salads, noodles, etc. The green tea gelato is good, but we've had better that tasted less freeze burnt. (If you want ice cream after this meal, definitely walk around the corner to Lee's Ice Cream Liquor - alcohol infused ice cream to die for!)   I would definitely recommend this for happy hour or a birthday with friends.
Sushi!!! Rock and Roll!!! Need I say more???  Come say hi to my friends Jimmy, Jim, and Sid behind the bar every night!

I honestly don't know where to start. But first let me say that I normally don't leave yelps but I felt that his needed to be said! We walked in and were immediately sat by the host. It took about 5 minutes just for someone to stop by and grab us waters and then finally 20 MINUTES LATER our server finally greeted the table. (Let me just mention by the way that this was a Tuesday at 6:00 and the restaurant was fairly slow). We placed our drink and food order at the same time (because we had so much time to figure out what we wanted). The drinks that we ordered then took ANOTHER 15 minutes to get to us! At this point it's 6:55 and the whole reason we came was for happy hour which ends at 7:00. I walked over to the server and asked if we could put in one more drink before it was over and she agreed to it. At this point we have been here for 40 minutes and finally got our drinks. On top of all of this when our food came out we were missing 3 items that the server rang in and the kitchen never sent out!! I'm gonna end this by saying our server was a very sweet girl but when it finally came to order she just asked if we were ready before even introducing herself! The restaurant, waitresses, kitchen, bar and management need to get their sh*t together!

Very disappointed in the service tonight. We arrived for happy hour and put in a sushi order with our server, after 30 minutes it became apparent she had forgotten to put in our order. The table of three ordered 3 yellow tail rolls a California roll and tuna roll. After we expressed our disappointment on our wait, a woman who I am assuming is a manager came out at 6:30 and informed us our wait was put in at 5:50 (we placed our order at 5:30) so we hadn't been waiting as long as we claimed. She did notify us they were short staffed however the restaurant was fairly empty, I counted 6 tables as we walked out (dead on Valentine's Day, maybe that should have been our first clue not to go there). An hour wait for simple rolls seems like a ridiculous wait. We had to repeatedly remind our server of things we requested. She did not check on our table often and if we happened to flag down another server they would say "uh ya I'll get your server". My water was never refilled in the 2 hours we sat there. I had thought about putting in another order of sushi considering how long the wait was but then decided it really wasn't worth the wait. The sushi is as good as you would expect a place that turns into a bar/nightclubs I have only really been here before for drinks. Not to mention the happy hour menu is pretty weak, only maki rolls, apps and select drinks. Not sure I will be making a return here for sushi/happy hour.

Fun, fun, fun.  I am so not a hipster or Scottsdale club hopper. In fact I am most comfortable hitting up dive bars and hole in the wall ethnic places. So it took me along time to try out Geisha even though I have heard about it relentlessly from my "cool" friends.  We had a double date during happy hour, which is perfect for good prices, availability, and people watching.  The atmosphere is pretty cool. It borders on cheesy but it is still pretty fun. I love the pics of the rock starts on the wall. That makes any place cool.   The music they were blasting was a great mix of rock, new and old.   People watching was incredible. Highly entertaining, especially if you are married and in your 30's like me and you want to watch the mating game unfold in front of your eyes.  The sushi was so-so. Can't complain with the half off prices though.  The drinks were really good but I couldn't repeat the names of them to my server without blushing...  Veggie lettuce wraps were good, nothing outstanding. My favorite dish were the vegetable gyozas. They were delicious! Next time I'm skipping the sushi and ordering 2 orders of them. The filling was delicious and they were grilled perfectly. The spicy mustard aioli it came with was perfect.   Service was good. Our server was a typical Scottsdale babe, except she was nice and NOT a pretentious wench like some of them can be.   Management checked on us a couple times to see how we are doing, which is always nice.  We had a blast and will definitely be back...

Let me start by saying I'm probably older than most of the people reviewing this place. I choose my eateries based on the food...the vibe is important, but secondary. So I'll limit my comments on the whole karaoke thing....yes, it's probably a decent place to party down, get smashed and make a fool of yourself, if you're into that sort of thing. But I'm a retired musician, so I've done more than my share of belting out a tune. I came here for the food.  So...the vibe didn't do much for me when I walked in....it's set up more like a bar than a restaurant...cramped, dark and loud. Fortunately, it was a pleasant evening, and only around 6PM (it was a dinner meeting), so I was able to miss the rush =and= grab a table outside. A table full of noisy drunk yuppie college kids and some poorly chosen music could have harshed my mellow if I'd been in a crummy mood...but I wasn't, and it didn't.  As to the food....for a sushi snob, it's not easy to find decent sushi anywhere in the Phoenix area. So I was pleasantly surprised. The fact that it was happy hour and all the appetizers were half price made it even more pleasant. Tried the spider roll, tuna roll, sashimi, and some non-sushi items too...ahi sliders, cucumber salad...all quite good. The spring rolls were a bit nondescript, but all in all, not bad. The service...well, the waitress was cute and called everyone darling, but I'd have rather she actually knew how to pay attention. (Okay, I guess I'm showing my age again, but I've fulfilled most of my waitress fantasies, and these days I just want them to bring me my food on time.)  All in all...not bad. I'd eat there again, but I'd try and make sure I could sit outside.

I love geisha! We would come here basically every Sunday until we had a baby! Staff is usually always on point! We decided to go last night and our waitress (Jeanette ) was AWFUL! I tried to order an app and she walked away Saying she would be back but all she did was go up to the bar and was on her phone taking videos of th guys at the bar. my boyfriend and I had to walk up to the bar multiple times because she never came to ask if we needed anything . She was to busy flirting with the guys at the bar. She completely ignored me when I went up to the bar to order more stuff and pay. When she was taking our order she was leaning on my boyfriends leg and only asked what he wanted. She was so unprofessional. I've never had such terrible service. I still tipped her 18% but honestly she didn't deserve it. Im not one to write bad reviews but she needs to learn good customer service.

If you are looking for noisy hipster club with a karaoke asian decor and just ok sushi this is your place. I like the concept cool looking place lots of pretty people and great music and decor. So for drinks and a hang out I might return. We had to try the pokemon roll topped with Fritos. So weird we had to try it. It didn't work. Actually everything we tried was about the quality of grocery store sushi. Cool looking place neat concept but food falls flat.

I f*ckin love Geisha. I just do. It's awesome sushi, and an even more awesome atmosphere and happy hour.   The fried rice on happy hour is such a good bang for your buck, and so damn good.  The rock shrimp appetizer is cocaine to me.  Great cocktails, live DJ, gorgeous wait staff. Karaoke room. Fantastic location. Can't ask for more.

The best thing about this place are the bathrooms! No Shit! Er, I mean no kidding!  The decor in the bathroom is expensive, mimicking a Japanese ancient Castle, with large cuts on stone masonry, copper pots for sinks, and metal tubes to look like large bamboo as the faucets.   The next best thing is the large stone in the middle of the room. It is a large rock with a spotlight on it, and mimicks a Japanese rock garden.  The third best thing is the out door patio seating, with the misters going full blast as the tempurature still hovers around 100 at 11:00pm in August. There are several tables out there, and also some couches.  The 4th best thing is the Pachinko machines in the entryway, brightly lit and real, However, as the cute hostess will tell you, she has no balls (for the pachinko machines, stupid!)  The 5th best thing is their large drink menu of specialty drinks. I didn't look in there for an "Orgasm" or a "SloeComfortableScrew Against the Wall", or other ridiculous concoctions, etc.   I felt like a Tanqueray and Tonic.  No, Make it two!  The rest of what they have to offer is, well, meh!

First and Foremost - The red-headed Asian Bartender with Tattoos gets you Five stars off the bat.   Stumbled in here after getting a pretty bad old fashioned up the street. And began trying out the flavor infused sake. Got a carafe of Mango followed by Pomegranate. Each carafe came with at least 8 shots, it was me and my boss, so after the two carafes we got a little buzz. Wanted to try out the karaoke rooms but we ended up taking off to meet up with some colleagues. We were being helped by a blonde bartender who was excellent. Gave good service and small talk for some out of towners.  Alcohol. Karaoke. Food. Sounds like a pretty good night just make sure you bring some friends.

I went to GAGG for Happy Hour on a Saturday with a large group of friends to celebrate a birthday.  We were very excited Happy Hour goes until 7pm even on weekends.  They have an extensive appetizer menu with all items priced at 50% off.  In addition they offer great deals on drinks and saki!  Our serveer was very attentive and managed a large group with separate checks with out any problems.  I'll definitely be going back!

Completely terrible and inattentive service by a waitress (hair looked like it hadn't been washed in days), added extra items to our bill, rushed our dining experience by bringing the bill before we'd even gotten our food, and Scott (the manager) responded in the most unprofessional manner when these concerns were calmly and maturely brought to his attention. I've NEVER seen such rude customer service or abhorrent brand representation - and I've worked in the restaurant industry for a decade. I'm completely appalled and disgusted, and would give zero stars if it was an option.

I went for my birthday last night and it was our first time dining here. I'm pretty sure our server's name was Melanie. I will say it wasn't the best sushi I've ever had, but the service was friendly and quick. I gave this place 5 stars because I simply felt like our server put in time to go above and beyond for me on my birthday. Our server brought me a chocolate cake with a candle in it and even gave us a discount on our bill.  She is a great part of your team! We will be back to give you guys another shot!

This place has a great happy hour special that can't be beat.  It's pretty good sushi as well.  Is it the best I've had? No, but it is great and the place has a great patio, fun music and an overall fun vibe.

We came in on a Friday 3/312017 at 7pm. We had a group of 8.  Took 45 minutes to sit at a table.  The main problem I had was the food and the service. I ordered and then I was forgotten. I was never asked for a refill on my beverage.  The food was not served at the same time in my group and I received my plate after everyone was done with their meal.   The sushi rice was over cooked and hard to swallow. If I'm paying scottsdale prices, I expect a decent meal with prompt customer service.   I would love to give you the ability to make up for those mistakes. As of right now I'm disappointed and unless I'm contacted by geisha I will not be coming back.
Favorite sushi place in Scottsdale! Great bar, really cool layout, and 50% off happy hour. The Dragonball roll is the best!

So things may have gotten off to a rocky start (losing our reservation for 13 and having to eat outside), but thanks to friendly service and yummy rolls, I found myself in a very forgiving mood.   Is this place super authentic for you sushi snobs? Definitely no. But it's a fun atmosphere and there are plenty of options for vegetarians, and even non-sushi eaters (everyone loved the chicken teriyaki sliders). The most memorable item of the night for me was a roll featuring crushed fritos. Sounds gross, I know, but with the katsu sauce on it it tasted more like panko breading than corn chips.   Most importantly, the cocktails are amazing - I could not get enough of my kiwi cocktail (I think it was called the kinky cooler - ignore the name and just try it!)  After dinner, we piled into one of the private karaoke rooms and thanks to our helpful waitress and many sake bombs, we had a wonderful night. They were lacking some randomly important karaoke songs, but we managed to have a good time regardless. I have to say I thought we'd get more use out of the pole in the middle of the room though!  Two very important notes, one good, one not so good:  First, you MUST go to the bathroom. Anyone who's ever been curious about those fancy Japanese toilets will have a blast in the ladies' room (can't speak for the boys' room). I'm surprised they put them in because I bet on busy nights a long line must form as people are testing out all the fun, weird functions on the toilet.   Second, a note to whoever writes the descriptions for the rolls on the menu: You may not have too many Asians in your life, but next time you're thinking of a way to describe your sushi, saying things like 'you no likey?' and 'herro!' are not appropriate and may be offensive to some!

Came in recently and had the pleasure of being taken care of by Mallorie. Truly exceptional service. She was very accommodating and guided us in the right direction of what to order and even told us of the Karaoke nights the establishment has. We will definitely be returning. Super friendly staff, and even better cuisine! 5 stars!

Awesome place!! I'm embarrassed to say I had never been here before, but decided to check it out when deciding on a fun place to begin my birthday festivities. Since I was getting a mixed group of friends together, I thought what could be a better way for everyone to get to know each other then over sushi and Saki bombing?!? Geisha nailed it! The ambiance was fun and hip, the food was FAB and the drinks were flowing. We didn't do the private karaoke room (with stripper pole!!!) this time, but don't you worry, we will definitely keep it in mind for the next fiesta!!!  Great place for dinner, drinks, and tons of fun!!
The sushi was delicious, different, and fresh.  It's a really cool place with a dj some nights. Check it out!
Sunday is all day happy hour! With in-house infused saki, atmosphere transplanted from Japan, and killer sushi what more do want?

I can't believe I lived in Scottsdale for over 2 years before going to Happy Hour here! It just made my day complete!   I've gone there late night before. After the usual first stop at Saddle Ranch, my friends and I would wander over to Geisha and of course hover around the rock in the middle of the floor. That was my first love of Geisha.  Now I've finally experienced their Happy Hour, which they even have on Sundays! How could you not love that? 1/2 price on all their drinks and appetizers--sign me up!!! Seriously though, the food was good. I had the veggie tempura, edamame, and gyoza (pork dumplings). I haven't developed a taste for sushi, but my friend loves it and has been going every Sunday for about 5 months now just to get it.  Plus, 1/2 price saki? Saki bombs anyone? Yes, please.

Dropped in for some drinks and good music. And they had a that and more. Casual chill vibe on Friday night. DJ played some throw back hip hop that was right up my alley. Staff/bartender was attentive and nice. If you're looking for something a little more tame and older than the clubs and lounges in the area this is a good spot for you.
Best happy hour on Sunday! All day! Order the Astro boy and dragonfly roll. Saki comes in many flavors! Super fun environment.
Awesome food and good vibes all around! This is a great sushi spot. Quick service and everyone was so nice! Solid Sunday Funday where they have happy hour specials and throwback music.

HAPPY HOUR! With all honesty, I only go here for happy hour, but you can't pass it up!   $5 sake bombs = YESSSSS!  veggie gyoza= YUM! chicken gyoza = UHHH YUM!  and the rolls! oh the almighty rolls, they are all made to perfection ! They are really delicious.  All the apps are half price during happy hour, and there are so many choices!! it's excellent! and BONUS they have a DJ there sometimes that plays some groovy tunes.   In addition to the great prices, the location is killer too! Old town is really a great place to go out so if you're feeling rowdy enough to start drinking during happy hour, you can hit the bars a little bit later and make a night of it.  WIN WIN LADIES AND GENTS!

Went for drinks on Saturday night.  Arrived at 9pm and the place was packed but cleared out around 1130.  The pomegranate sho chu was amazing and for 8 bucks a carafe you cant wrong.  I will be going back there again.
Great place to have drinks and to grab a bite before heading out for the night. Great service good sushi.. be nice if it was a little bit bigger. More tables, other then that good place.

They know sushi you know sushi. What do you want to know. Ok good vibe rocking music and pretty Scottsdale people. Not crazy crowded since it's off the main drag. Can't say more. Been here twice sure I'll be back

This is one of the best places to go for happy hour! Especially for their all-day happy hour on Sundays. If you don't like sushi don't worry their menu has plenty of other options. I recommend the ribs and the sliders which are half off for happy hour! One of the reasons I love coming here is for their flavored sakis which are also on special for happy hour.

Geisha is easily one of my favorite places to get sushi in the Valley. From their happy hour prices, to the quality of their fish, Geisha just can't be beat.  Ambience: 70s hip rock 'n roll vibe, lots of teak and green. There's mostly rock that plays on the radio, however it doesn't detract from conversation or your meal. For seating, there's patio seating, table seating, and booth seating. Oh, and the bar.  Service: honestly, I could dock a star for service. The last time we were here, our waitress was a bit cold. She seemed more interested in herself than her job or our lunch. This place is heavily frequented and staffed by your typical Scottsdale snobbery. She neglected to tell us that happy hour is all day on Sundays, and we only found out because we overheard it at the table next to ours. She also removed our chicken lettuce wraps from the table before we finished. That being said, I did notice that the waiter at the table next to us was very helpful, polite and friendly. So perhaps we just got a bad egg.  Food: both times that I've been to Geisha, I've had the pleasure of enjoying their happy hour prices. For appetizers, I would recommend the chicken lettuce wrap, the short ribs, or the tempura. I've tried all three and can say that I would happily order all three again. As for the rolls, I would recommend the spicy yellowtail roll. We've ordered other rolls in the past, and remember them being just as good and fresh.  Price: I can't say when their happy hour is midweek, but I can tell you that happy hour is all day on Sundays! Happy hour includes half off all appetizers, house rolls, draft beers, and other things that I can't remember at this time. The normal price of their roles is comparable to any other sushi establishment in the valley, but their happy hour prices are definitely something to go in for. The normal price on appetizers is a bit steep for my taste, but definitely worth their value on happy hour.   And so, to sum: Geisha has fantastic happy hours on Sundays and I wouldn't miss it if I was in the area.

Top notch fun , bar lounge, and food.   My guy and I  go here almost every Wednesday, when we get into town then usually two more times over the weekend.   Music- There is a dj spinning music onthe weekends and no question the best DJ in Scottsdale , playing music mash ups people actually can dance to not just a bunch of hip hop or house music. Every now and then late night the middle area turns into quite the drunk dance floor which makes for fun dancing or really fun people watching.  Eats- We usually load up in sashimi, which the chef came out to talk to us how it was nice to see people eating real japanese not just balls of cream cheese and rice. Everything has always been super fresh. I swear I cannot lie with out the ahi tuna sliders. We always bring a large group who always leave very happy. Its a great place to start the night at!!  Service- The girls are super cute but every know and then it takes a bit too long to get a drink but when you order a comlicated martini , you cant really complain!! I love the "picachoo" yum yum.  Overall the best scottsdale stop . A million times more fun and delish then Ra or stingray!

Had a very wonderful meal here! Ordered the shrimp tempura for an appetizer.....very tasty with a delicious slightly spicy aioli sauce. We also ordered The Flying Kamikaze (unagi, salmon, tuna and crab in unagi sauce and sweet thai chili)...awesome!  And then the Geisha A Go Go (lobster tempura, crab mix, avacado and cream cheese wrapped in green soy paper topped with jalapeno cream sauce)....also very good. For drinks I had the Kinki Cooler made with Cachaca, Kiwi Fruit and Lime....delicious and tasted quite strong : ) Dessert was the Cinnamon Banana Crisp......a perfect ending. The waitress was also kind enough to show us the private karaoke booths they have.....we will be coming back with a small group to try this out next time....looks like fun :  )......... They also have happy hour specials with great savings. Highly recommend.

Some friends and I went here for happy hour recently. All of the appetizers, maki and some of the drinks are half-price 5-7pm, so we each ordered a couple appetizers and sushi plates. Everyone raved about the teriyaki ribs - soft, juicy and slightly spicy - a plate of about 5 for $5 at happy hour was quite reasonable. Tamago (sweet egg) was bland, but the avocado roll (nicely priced at $1.75) was plump and fresh. Chicken lettuce wraps were just okay; my favorite lettuce wraps are at Ginger China Bistro up in Glendale, and these were passable but not something I'd order again.  A friend ordered a Turning Japanese (a specialty drink made up of orange-infused sho chu, Japanese melon soda, vodka & Asian fruit juice), and after offering everyone at the table a sip, we all agreed it was exquisite. Seriously good stuff - even though it had a lot of alcohol in it, it did not taste alcohol-y.   Kudos to the chef for redoing an entree to make it allergen-free for one of our party. Nice to have a chef and waitress who know what 'anaphylactic' means.  Cons - The music was very loud and not my style. After a while I couldn't wait to go outside for some quiet, and to get out from under the penetrating stares of the three tragically dead rockers on the wall. As other reviewers have questioned, what are they doing here? Looming over the bar, are they there to serve as a cautionary tale? As a heads-up on the music played there, i.e., that few tunes are from female-fronted bands? Shrug.  The tables are low and funky (in terms of shape) and the seat cushions do not provide much in the way of back support. They do have regular chairs, but the 'floor' option was easier for a group. However, there's no one there scolding you for bad posture, and quite a few floor dwellers were slouching happily.   This place was designed for people far more limber and hipper than me, such as the waitresses - fabulously gorgeous and sewn into tight black dresses crafted purposely to show off miles of tanned, toned legs. I watched people's eyes follow the waitresses around the room. Indeed, they were quite the distraction.  All in all, I'd come back for happy hour - but sit in regular chairs and leave before my ears reached sensory overload.

This place has a lot of hype. I think because it is nestled in the heart of ot Scottsdale. I just thought the service was extremely slow and it was so crowded in there people were literally waiting behind people at the bar for them to leave.  Just too slow and busy, I'll try it again on a week day

Geisha has become my go-to when I need to satisfy the sushi craving.  2 things that keep this sushi-lover coming back regularly...  Quality sushi, and affordable prices.  Aside from the decor, karaoke, and the service...  The happy hour has great pricing which make it affordable to visit once or twice every week.    If they were open for lunch, I would probably visit more often.

My girlfriends and I were so excited to come here for girls night out. We were going to do karaoke, eat sushi and drink saki bombs aka have a GREAT time. We reserved one of the private karaoke rooms so we could sing all of our favorite songs judgement free. When we arrived and gave our name to the hostess we were escorted to our "karaoke room", there are not enough words to describe this room. It is nothing like the pictures online and our waitress even said the pics online are out of date. The smallest room, which is what we  reserved for $100, is about 10ftx10ft and that's a generous measurement. There's a DISGUSTING couch in there that is cracked and heavily used and scratch/scrape marks all along the walls. In front of the couch is a coffee table to eat off of and a small entertainment center directly in front of that with a karaoke program that you operate yourself. We would've been better off and more comfortable doing karaoke at someone's home since there wasn't even enough room to stand and sing in our tiny little panic room.   We let our waitress know immediately that we were not comfortable in the karaoke room we reserved and we no longer wanted to use the room. She spoke with her manager and even though we weren't using the room we still had to pay $100 for our last minute cancellation. I understand that they could've booked someone else in that room but, who would've wanted to be in there? It is quite possibly the most uncomfortable room I have ever been in. On top of that, we also had to bargain with the manager (who never even approached us to apologize for the misunderstanding) to have the gratuity removed from our $100 bill.   Needless to say, our girls night out left much to be desired. We went from so excited and willing to drop way more than $100 on a great evening to just getting 1 sushi roll each and 1 drink and leaving.   Impressions of Geisha A Go Go- Poor customer service, false advertising, mediocre sushi.  We will not be returning.

Great happy hour, I can't believe I'm saying this, but their sushi is definitely better than their sister restaurant Stingray, where I USED to be a regular until I came here. Happy Hour is 1/2 off house sushi, appetizers and drinks. The prices are similar to stingray but with a much bigger selection, not only for the sushi but for the appetizers and drinks as well. I will be back...ALL THE TIME!  Try the Astro Boy!

First of all I'm a regular for this place when it comes to happy hour. Last time I came this really nice bartender offered to buy me my drink. They know how to keep good loyal costumers. Their sushi I pretty good for the price and they have a large menu of sushi. Their appetizers are awesome also, I always get the Rockin Shrimp! Never disappoints. Also all the house saki is not only DIRT cheap during happy hour it has enough variety for every person who has a different taste! My favorite alcohol drink is the Kiwi Cooler. It's just lime juice,vodka, fresh kiwi and soda water. Doesn't leave you feeling all sugary or bloated!

I have recently visited the scottsdale location and i have no plans on returning the food is below average and the service is lacking.  Edit:  Went back to try this place again  walked in at 950 and was told i couldn't even sit for a quick drink because they were closed

This place sucked as far as good quick service. We got seated and no one came to our table for a good 15 min till we had to go grab a manager. Food was garbage. Only good part about this place is Sunday all day happy hour which I guess would only be good if you drink.
Usually I write more, but just this: there are better places around, as well as better in good and better in prices. It's a bar and not a restaurant in my opinion

When first told about the concept I thought of the little Karaoke houses that have overtaken Japan in the past couple of years and hoped that G.A.G.G. would live up to all the hype.  I was met by an attractive host at the door that allowed me to view the private karaoke rooms which were very nice but a little pricey. Great place for a group date, if you all like to sing and drink Sake.  Speaking of Sake, my friend and I ordered the floral,,, which was ....O,K. i really didn't have any desire to try it but my friend insisted.  After enough time i finally submitted to the Sake. We ordered a half which came in a nice bamboo shoot.  It was a nice presentation. The crowd was attractive but after a while of relaxing viewing the restaurant my companions and I started to notice how all the men were talking to men and only some of the women were talking to anybody.  Kinda weird but you can get the idea.  We didn't try any of the food, but the one thing i will worn about is the Giant Rock that at some point will be the cause of some injuries. Overall i liked the decor and the vibe but dint know how often i would visit this place. best thing about it is the mixing of music and the private karaoke.

If if wasn't for a rude hostess I might bump this place up to 5 stars. That being said, this place still offers an AWESOME happy hour! Not only is there several, cheap, options but the sushi is actually GOOD (let's be honest, that's not always the case w/happy hour sushi). Also, HH is EVERY day (including Sundays).   I've also never been to a place that's so accommodating at splitting bills. Seriously, they ASK you immediately if you wanna do so, and don't mind if every single person in your 10-person party wants there own bill!

I love this place! Good quality fish they use in the sushi and great infused sake selection. This is my go to Sunday spot because they have all day happy hour Sunday. The atmosphere is great along with the kick ass bartenders!

Stopped in because we really wanted sake bombs. We got something we did not expect - a whole carafe of sake & a huge can of sapporo! We got at least 3-4 bombs out of it and it was just $12 for each of us! Just another reason why I love Geisha A Go Go.

Just ooooookay.  I didn't use this place to its full potential I'm sure it is good in large groups. It was sooo dark and loud in there and the other customers were loud as well.  I don't hold that against them since it IS a karaoke bar.  First off the sushi was a little overpriced for what it was, I didn't get much for what I payed and the service wasn't great.  my waitress was absent until it was time to pay the check.    I think this place would be great in large group as you get your own private room with karaoke.

Definitely good as far as I'm concerned.  Not the best sushi you'll ever have, but for the prices, it's just fine.  Also, the crowd is great, just so long as you aren't a bigoted hick who is afraid of her husband turning gay after (possibly - maybe) being hit on by one guy...LOL.  Seriously, check it out.

I have only been here for Happy Hour, but it probably the best happy hour in Scottsdale for the price. Not bad sushi and excellent happy hour drink specials. I would give this place 5 stars, but their sashimi is meh. I love their lychee flavored sake bombers. The atmosphere is really fun and if the temperature is right try to sit on the patio.

Occassionally visit for happy hour. Things are generally over priced, both food and drinks. The sushi is generic and typical. This place gets 2 stars only because there non sushi dishes are hit or miss but can be worth a try.

Sat at the bar during Happy Hour on a Friday- HH is everyday 4-7pm and all day Sunday. I ordered the cucumber, gin drink to start. It was refreshing; about half the drink is alcohol, but you can't tell.. served in a tall glass- $12 reg, 1/2 off at HH. It was good- exactly what you'd expect, but nothing over the top. I then switched to Kim Crawford Sauv Blanc- my go to $10.50 a glass here. Also ordered the chicken lettuce wraps. They were ok- the hot mustard they're served with will light your mouth and nostrils on !! Be careful with how much you add. Also served with two other sauce options. It's a filling meal and only about $6 at HH. Bartender highly recommended the rock shrimp app- really regret not trying it! All apps are 1/2 off at HH. Enjoy!
Geisha has an awesome happy hour. $20 gets you very well fed with a substantial buzz. Word to the wise: Get the infused sake.

Don't get me wrong, I love this place! You can't beat their happy hour specials, the cucumber lemongrass house infused sake, or the energy inside. That's what keeps me coming back.   The service is hit or miss. If you can get a seat at the bar, that's about the only time I actually have received good service. I've been there countless times with a party of two where there are plenty of tables open only to be told the only place they can seat 2 is at the cramped sushi bar that servers are constantly walking by with food, but not actually checking on you. The plus side to that is the sushi comes out almost immediately, but you'll be waiting and waiting on the appetizers and drinks. Maybe if you're dining with a large group you'll be seen as a more valuable customer and will receive better service, this is just what I've consistently experienced in almost 3 years of going here.   Overall a great spot, if the service was better it would easily be 5 stars for me - they have rent out karaoke rooms, an upbeat Rock N Roll theme, and a great menu of food and specialty drinks. Happy Hour is 1/2 price apps, maki rolls and drinks, which is unbeatable. Just don't come here for the top notch service because you won't find it.

It has more of a college bar feel than Hip Tokyo sushi bistro.   I could see where it could be fun possibly as a club sort of venue with friends on a very crowded Friday night.   But, it's marketed as a hip sushi bistro and didn't really deliver. The night was light with customers, only a few tables, yet, they struggled to keep glasses full and service the table. Food was OK. The bento box teppan was disappointing, small, and over priced. The sushi rolls were OK but, you wouldn't be surprised to get them in a mall. The drinks were good.   Unfortunately, we ended up having to go for 'second dinner' at another restaurant after wards to end up with a decent meal for the night.   Oddly I think the place is owned by the same folks that own Stingray, yet Stingray is delicious and is such a major step up over Geisha it's hard to believe it's from the same parents.   I almost never rate restaurants this low, but, it just was a bad experience for what it claims to be. If it was marketed as a bar to get drunk, get sick, and jostle with friends, OK... two stars.. but, it's nothing like anything you'd see in Tokyo.

Not gonna lie, I was excited to come in here, have some amazing sushi. Reviews looked on point. Was seated at the sushi bar, it looked abandoned.  There was no one around. The sushi bar had no fish, and it had no sushi guy. There was some rando guy waiting for the bathroom.  I left. The place is more of a scene than a location to eat. I guess I would go here to look cool, but I'm already cool af. Ps- thanks for your response. But why would you seat someone at a closed sushi bar? Still amateur. Your staff seated me there.

The sushi here is very good, but to be honest that was not the reason we went here.  This is a fun place to chill, have a few drinks, a few rolls and save a few bucks.  If I lived in Scottsdale I can imagine I would frequent here - no question.  It's not a large place, and I'm sure this place gets crowed at times. We went during an off time and It was great.  They staff was helpful, casual and I have to say -  extremely attractive.  Stop by here during happy hour or to grab a drink and a sushi roll as an app before dinner.  It's a fun place.
Decent sushi-- not the best. We all ordered different cocktails and they were all terrible. They were super syrupy like something you would order at Applebee's. Atmosphere is a bit groggy.

Scott was totally unresponsive. We had a party and he shut our power off on the private room within 5 min. If you have a party here plan on not going over 5 min. And cutting it short. Not a place my dental staff will be going again.

We had a good experience. I was a little weary after reading recent reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. We went to Geisha on a Sunday at 3:45pm. We were a party of seven, including two teenaged girls. The atmosphere is low lit and semi-loud music, but it fits the restaurant. Our food was at the table within 5 minutes and the waitress was quick to fill water glasses and answer questions. Truly, it was a pleasant visit. The food was great and we will come back again.
Love it here ! The vibe is always great ! The sake + Rock Shrimp w Eel sauce is my go to !

I wouldnt really say its "as good as it gets" but I cant fathom preventing them from getting 5 stars considering I have no complaints. This has become Sushi Saturday for us. They have happy hour on weekends. We dont go for the drinks for happy hour, but for the food. They have a very nice tasty variety of specialty rolls (not included in happy hour)

This was my second time at Geisha both were for my birthday. Last year we had a great time and they really went above and beyond I would give that experience 4.5 stars! The server was great and we had so much fun. This year they were kind of snooty with us. We were all ordering food spending money and they come in the room and demand the money for the room rental. It was embarrassing. They had my credit card why in the world they did that was beyond me. We also got the "big" room this time and I was expecting more food as per advertised on the website. Nope. 2 little trays of food. I think we had 4 trays last time in the small room that's only $100 an hour. The large room isn't cheap even half off you have to book 2 hours so it's $150. I don't think I will be repeating again next year. Just not worth the hassle. Also their website has a bunch of false info about happy hour. Beware. Many of my friends were charged different prices for the same things.

I don't think I'm the typical Old Town bar goer; however, I thoroughly enjoyed this place. My husband and I went for happy hour before our dinner reservations elsewhere. We sat at the bar and ordered a few of their specialty cocktails. Their happy hour menu is great--nice prices, good selection.   The bar staff was very attentive, and we enjoyed their infused sake recommendations. While the place was crowded, we never felt boxed in at the bar.   The atmosphere is very hip and fun, and I'd  be interested in doing karaoke there. They have it in the main area on Sundays, and you can rent private karaoke rooms others times, too.   Didn't get to try the sushi, but I will definitely be back there to sample the food (and probably more booze) menu.

Fairly good place. I come here every couple months, during happy hour times. The prices can't be beat. In fact I've never actually ordered anything NOT on happy hour. The Hello Kitty cocktail is good. Kind of creamy and sweet. Pretty pink girlie drink. They have great sake infusion flavors. I've had a handful of appetizers. All good for the prices. The house rolls are half off on happy hour. They aren't the best in town but like I've said, the price is right. However we went yesterday and this was the first time I really wasn't impressed. The fish was kind of gray and it just didn't taste fresh. I probably should have spoken up, but I didn't. And I feel fine today. So that's what matters. The thing I don't like about this place is the atmosphere. It's dark and sort of dingy, especially in the summer when it's too hot to sit outside. Also it is the quint essential Scottsdale douchebag joint. Big groups of bros and twenty something girls trying too hard and getting drunk at 3pm. Not the classiest of crowds. I think the place needs a facelift. My fiancé came here is 2011 and said it hasn't changed. I will probably go back when the weather is nice again but sitting inside just doesn't cut it for me. It's just depressing.

I have been here many times and I couldn't believe I hadn't written a review yet!  If I'm a snob about 1 thing, it would be sushi.  I have a difficult time finding sushi I really like in Arizona, but this place never disappoints!  Sushi always tastes fresh and it is delicious regardless of whether I get a basic roll or a specialty roll.  If you come during happy hour, you can fill up, get drunk, and get out of there ridiculously cheap.  For example, I went yesterday for happy hour and got a carafe of cucumber lemongrass infused sake (probably about 10 shots) for $4.25, and 2 cali rolls w/ smelt eggs (highly recommended!) for $5.75, for a total of $10 + tax and tip.

I love this place for happy hour! Their infused sake is refreshing and totally wallet friendly! The potstickers are my favorite and I always order them. It is a great place to visit with friends or something relaxing and fun for a simple date.

I do eat here relatively often because my sister is a big fan but me eh not so much. It's OK like nothing fantastic, nothing terrible but when people say "How about Geisha?" My usual reaction is "Yeah that's fine" but what I'm really thinking is the following review:   They have some inventive rolls but they are largely deep fried which I'm not a big fan of. Maybe I'm just being a snob (I am kind of a snob; full disclosure) but I feel like it's a little run down and old. It doesn't smell musty but it's one of those places that look like it could. Also, it's not like it's cheap; usually you'll spend about $40 bucks for two people I mean that's not a lot by old town standards but considering the sushi is ho hum and it feels a little old and like it hasn't been renovated in awhile I personally don't think it's worth it. When I go out to eat in Old Town I expect nice decor and delicious and this place just doesn't do it for me.

I went here with a few friends for happy hour yesterday - I had did a bit of research and was undecided and would try it out anyways. I looked online prior to going to get a good idea of what I would want (I'm very picky about my sushi being that I am from California and know quality fish) and decided I would keep it simple and order off the happy hour menu. Prior to ordering, I had the waitresses (we had two for some reason, could possibly have been a training situation, but it was never relayed to us) explain the options and ordered from their explanations. Everything I ordered was ok - they did have some great vegetable tempura, everything was fresh. When we got our bills, they separated them (which was nice) but I noticed that we were charged regular price for everything that was marked "Happy Hour". I tried to nicely ask a girl at the front, and she played it off and said that prices have changed and I simply replied that they should market these changes better consider people are coming for the happy hour deals. I didn't feel like holding myself up any further since we were leaving to watch the game, but I definitely will not be returning. I feel like I was cheated out of my money and the customer service was less than par. The one star is for the tempura lol - even if it was still inexpensive - this day and age, it is not that difficult to update menus and staff of current deals or to accommodate a customer if they catch you in a mess up.

Two words: Happy Hour. They have an awesome one that's everyday from 3-7 and all day on Sundays. Their appetizers, drinks, and sushi are all half off and there's a lot to choose from. I'm a big fan of their kinky kooler to drink. The pot stickers and teriyaki ribs are awesome. All of the sushi I've tried so far has been fresh and tasty.   There's a reason they call it happy hour, because it truly is the happiest hour of them all especially at Geisha. The music is rocking, the ambiance is cool, and the drinks are free flowing...err...maybe not free but half off is a pretty good deal!  If you want a decent place to sit, get there early as it gets really crowded from 5-7. This is a place I frequent while in Scottsdale.
The resturants food was good not amazing. The DJ that night gets two thumbs up. The prices are a little high, but thats Scottsdale. I like the design the most, but really nothing great otherwise

Alright. My 12 year old son (yelp elite in the making) says I should rate our evening 2 stars but I will give them 3. Bad first impression. Difficult to get a table but it was Friday night. Sashimi was good quality ahi. The Gaigin roll (sushi) was interesting (although the waitress didn't know how to pronounce it) and had a good kick. I was not disappointed. The ramen was weak, the sweet and spicy chicken was average and the service was sporadic, at best.
Had an amazing time! Food was great, drinks were better, and the service was the best! We sat at the bar and Greg took such great care of us!

Their sushi sucks. The fish tastes dirty and the overall rolls taste old. Their drinks are decent though. And they have all day happy hour on Sunday which is awesome. The only roll I do like here is there dessert roll that's made with Rice Krispies and vanilla ice cream.

Geisha is my favorite place to go to after work! Jimmy and Tucker are the most personal and friendly bartenders I have ever encountered! Cam always goes out of his way to say hi and to make sure I get my food quickly. The service prevails while the food and drinks follow a close 2nd :D

Open till late and food is ok but the ambience is great...AWESOME FOR A MID-NIGHT DRINK  So! Dont roll your eyes when your read what's next. I wanna go to this place again to check out the "TOTO." (If u don't know, I ain't telling).  The food is not gonna be heavenly but it s fine for a sushi dinner. Love the Sake carafes! (might have had 2, all by myself) Great place to go with a bunch of friends and could be a potential douche bag hang-out depending on what time of the night. Food is a little overpriced but who cares about food when you are drunk.   It gets a half-extra star (so technically 3.5 stars) for the late hours

I have never really been a fan of public masturbation, but then again, I had never been to Geisha A Go Go's restrooms before either. Ladies, they have an osculating bidet that has front and back controls.......  There was a large (and excessively rowdy) group of us in one of the private Karaoke rooms celebrating Nathan S's 35th birthday this  past Saturday and I gotta say, I had a damn blast. We sang Love Shack and Sweet Caroline and Careless Wisperer. I even did an inappropriate duet to "Like A Virgin."  Oh, and those pear vodka champagne drink things?? I unknowingly sucked down 6 of them. Thanks to Georgie S for making sure it was Grey Goose. Anyway, sure I paid $54, but I was seriously having the best drunken blast and I felt like I hadn't touched a drop the next morning.  So, the waitress fucking hated us, but we had a g-damned blast. A BLAST. We twirled on poles, sang horrifically at the top of our lungs and probably contracted some diseases from the booths and carpets, but whatevs, it was a blast!  And P.S... I never actually used the bidet.... really... for more than a second

Fail! Absolute fail! Never even got to try the food. The doorman was beyond rude. After saying, "you aren't going anywhere without an I.D." (I'm 28, so not a problem) and while I reach for my i.d. I asked do you know what the wait is for a table, he responded "it's not my job to know how long your going to have to wait." That's fine, but common courtesy would have you say, "I'm sorry I don't know." Then when I asked the hostess who seemed utterly uninterested in helping people once again I got an answer of "ummm idk, 35-40." It's pretty sad. Everyone in Scottsdale has been nothing but respectful and kind, but apparently none of those people are who this business hires. The owner should look into his workers, if I owned this restaurant i'd be mortified that this is how my employees run my business. Disgraceful.

Awesome times!   I have been here a few times, usually in the late evening for the club. Most recently for happy hour for my friends birthday. We sat on the patio with the misters on, not the crazy kind that soak anything they touch, but they were perfect. The food was awesome! Price was very right as well. I think I had a spicy tuna roll, a caterpillar roll, and veggie gayoza and a cocktail for less than $15. Score!   I HAVE to tell you about our waitress as well, I believe her name was Lindsay. She was so helpful! Gave good recommendations, very attentive, and even when all eight of use were yelling out an order she got everything right! Go and request her!   Other than happy hour they have a pretty fun dance club after hours. They also have karaoke rooms. So much fun, you have to try it. They are private rooms, so you only have to make a fool of yourself in front of your close personal friends. Great for parties!   Have fun!

This is still one of my favorite spots in Scottsdale, quality continues to keep up as well as friendly service, the happy hour is from 4 to 7 I believe so it is good!! The sushi portions are great so are the quality and flavor, still they get 4 stars for their very limited sushi menu. Today I'm taking advantage of the happy hour and intend to get very happy, instead of rolls I ordered the sushi sampler and looks good and plenty full. I guess if you want more options you could go across to Stingray, but you will fin lower quality and yes higher prices. What I like here the most, after the food, is the ambiance, the place is cool and trendy the bar/terrace is the best place to start the night early before heading to a club. If you haven't been here, I know options are plentiful but you have to make this stop a most! Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

Disclaimer, I'm a older Japanese American man. In saying that my rating of two stars is fair. This place is not for old Japanese folks who have been raised in a Japanese home, eating Japanese food. I knew this coming into it, just by the name of the place. The pounding music, TV'S on most of the walls and the absence of anyone even looking Asian confirmed my suspensions.  Decent bar fair but terrible Japanese food let's not get the two mixed-up.  You come here to get drunk and have a good time, eat some food, get a taxi. You don't come here to experience the Japanese culture through food and drink.  Last words...once is enough, pass.

Great for Happy Hour - if you keep it simple - but not particularly good otherwise.  This restaurant is in a very convenient location and there's almost always parking right in front.  You can sit outside on the patio and when the weather's nice, it's lovely.  Happy Hour is a great deal with a large beer for about three bucks and half-price appetizers and maki.  If you stick to the maki - spicy tuna roll, etc. -  you won't be disappointed.  If you order anything else, you probably will be disappointed.   Pro: Good location Nice outdoor patio Great happy hour  Stick to cheap beer and maki  Con: Everything other than the maki is pretty lame Classic rock 24/7

So far, the best sushi in Phoenix/Scottsdale. Living in Phoenix has been rough for me since I'm a SoCal native and used to eating sushi all the time at my favorite hole in the wall. While Geisha-a-go-go is nowhere close to a hole in the wall, they do serve damn good sushi!   The prices were pretty reasonable. The fried rice was the best thing I've eaten! It was so delicious. I wanted to do a repeat of that dish. The rolls were all delicious and tasty, although nothing I special, but so far the best I've ever had since living here. The dessert was ok. It was a friend banana lumpia dish. The really good part of that dessert though was the coconut gelato, which I found out they order from a local gelato shop. So nothing special there.   The ambiance and location are what sets this sushi place a part from the others in Phoenix. I love the rock n' roll influenced decor and loud rock music blaring. I especially liked the part where the waitresses were not trying to impress by greeting me in a horrible Japanese translation of hajimemashite or konichiwa. I've cringed at other restaurants that do that out here and it's not pretty.   The raspberry sake we had was more then enough for a party of four. The wait staff was ok. Nothing special to be honest, but she wasn't rude or anything, just average service.   I was bummed to find out later that they give out pretty funny fortune cookies. I didn't get one, and had to find out about it on Instagram. So if you are eating here, ask for a fortune cookie.

02.06.10  I love the decor of this place!  It's rock meets Japan - jrock, perhaps?  Karaoke happens in the private room(s) in the back.  So no drunken performances that night, whew.  Late night sushi until midnight while you drink.  Excellent.

This is one of my favorite sushi places in Phoenix! I love the ambience! And they have outdoor heating so that the patio is still available for use in the winter. The food and drinks are delicious (and have fun names!) Happy hour (which is during normal dinner time) includes half-priced drinks and maki, and helps you to get more bang for your buck. Old Town Scottsdale is such a wonderful place for a night out, and Geisha A-Go-Go is a perfect spot for sushi lovers. Parking is sometimes difficult, especially on the weekends, but we've always found a place, even if you have to walk a bit.
seared salmon special is the f&$%n   best thing in the world. I would eat it all day, everyday!

I've now been here 3 times and I love it.  Their happy hour menu and price are one of the best in town.  It's offered everyday from 3-7pm and even on the weekends!  HH men is half off appetizers, maki rolls and drinks.  They offer a big menu of appetizers ranging from spring rolls, lettuce wraps, tempura, fried shrimp and much more.  The vibe here on Sunday is great.  There's always lots of people hanging out, eating and listen to the great music that they play.  It's in Old Town so it's close to everything so you can always just grab a drink there and eat elsewhere and vice versa.  Restaurant is clean, spacious and the seating options are outside, inside and the bar area.

I wish I could give this place 0 stars. First off, if you go here with people that aren't 21 you aren't allowed in unless no one at the table drinks. You cannot go for dinner with underage friends and have a drink...ridiculous. Second, the staff is beyond rude. I came here with a service dog and they refused to let me have her on the patio despite my paperwork. They (illegally) asked me specific questions about my disability loudly and aggressively in front of a crowded restaurant, embarrassing me beyond belief. Despite the manager being rude, I decided to take my dog home and attempt to come back without having my ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY service dog. When I came back, the waitress refused to serve me despite the fact that I am well over 21 and was stone cold sober. Again, I pushed it aside and continued with my meal. When I continued to ask to have a glass of wine, the woman at the table next to me (who was trashed) jumped in and started screaming at me for being disrespectful. I finished my meal and left and I refuse to recommend this place to anyone. Insulting and treating someone different for a disability is disgusting.

Geisha is the place to be! Luckily for me everytime I've gone here it's been happy hour! So the sushi is half off, plus the house drinks and all the flavor infused sake is too! I have done a girls' day here and it was so much fun! We ate so much sushi and got a pretty good buzz going for a decent price and walked around old town afterwards. Upon checking my account later, i realized the waitress put an extra $40 on my tab, which was frustrating, because I had to come back and speak with the manager. The manager was kind of annoyed because he had to go back in the records and find my transaction using my credit card to fix the problem. When he came back he apologized and said he would buy me a drink for my troubles. I actually had other plans so I said "get me next time." So, next time I came with some friends and told the waitress the manager agreed to buy me a drink. When the bill came they had comped all of our drinks! I have since been back many times and have always had a great experience. The atmosphere is great whether you are seated inside or on the patio.

Ok so every night when my friends and I want to eat dinner we somehow always decide on sushi, and then somehow we always decide on geisha.... And every time we sit down there we say "WHY THIS AGAIN???". Maybe it's because it's the only sushi place in old town (except sting ray which has a terrible menu, is weirdly right next door, and owned by the same owners...).   Anyway, Geisha has a GREAT happy hour. Like i'm talking amazing. And some of the best infused sake I've ever had. And the food is pretty good too. The reason we always question why we go there is because some of the servers are just so rude and terrible. In fact, the one hostess (you know who you are...) is SO rude it actually baffles me every time. Some of my calmest friends have actually gotten into arguments with her. I will say that there are some great people who work there too. But that hostess....man she's gotta go
